title: PSYC3888 Can we trust this science?
text:
Groups


Exchange contact details.
Set up a virtual workspace to exchange messages and documents, like Slack or a Facebook group
Set up meetings



In writing this little book, I distilled the results of hundreds of studies to a short list of empirical generalizations. Broad lessons for how cognition and perception connect, it turns out.
In some ways, visual attention and memory are a coherent scientific field. I mean that findings from paradigms other than MOT generalize to MOT too.

title: PSYC3888 Can we trust this science?
text:
Homework

Do the readings
Choose a research article that interests you

For that article, try to fill out Justine’s columns

Create a copy of Google Sheet

Write down notes and problems that you have



Exciting

title: PSYC3888 Can we trust this science?
text:
Project process


Identify a research area of interest
Identify/choose some proxies of research trustworthiness.
Write a plan to measure those proxies.
Pre-register the plan
Divide up the plan and do it.

title: PSYC3888 Can we trust this science?
section: The relationship of multiple object tracking to other forms of attention
text:
The relationship of multiple object tracking to other forms of attention

Feature attention is global
Tracking is hemifield-specific

Remaining questions:

Is temporal resolution hemifield-specific?
What about statistical perception?
If you limit time of attention availability with my circular displays, does this prevent doing other tasks (dual tasks)?
